dt: {bc}a small narrow steep-sided valley that is larger than a gully and smaller than a canyon and that is usually worn by running water

et: borrowed from French, "torrrent of water, gully formed by running water," going back to Middle French, "torrent of water," derivative of {it}raviner{/it} "to run quickly, flow forcefully (of blood, water)," derivative of Old French {it}ravine{/it} "violent force, momentum," going back to Latin {it}rapīna{/it} "forcible carrying off of property, seizure and carrying off of a woman" {ma}{mat|rapine|}{/ma}
shortdef: a small narrow steep-sided valley that is larger than a gully and smaller than a canyon and that is usually worn by running water
